meanings.definition: A circular band worn as an ornament or a token of marriage.
meanings.sent1: She proudly displayed her wedding rings.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry store had a beautiful collection of rings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to play with the shiny rings.
meanings.sent4: The rings of Saturn are mesmerizing to behold.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bell rings through the quiet night.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things arranged in a circle.
meanings.sent1: The children formed a circle by holding hands and singing songs.
meanings.sent2: The circus performers stood in a tight rings during the show.
meanings.sent3: The students sat in rings to discuss their favorite books.
meanings.sent4: The rings of chairs around the campfire created a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The Olympic rings symbolize unity among nations.

meanings.sent1: The bell rings loudly to signal the end of class.
meanings.sent2: The phone rings, indicating an incoming call.
meanings.sent3: The laughter of the children rings through the playground.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful melody rings in my ears long after the concert.
meanings.sent5: The church bells rings joyfully on Sunday mornings.

meanings.sent1: She rings her best friend every evening to chat.
meanings.sent2: I will ring you later to discuss our plans.
meanings.sent3: He rings his mom whenever he needs advice.
meanings.sent4: The teacher rings the parents to inform them about the field trip.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to ring the doctor for an appointment.

meanings.sent1: The trees rings the clearing, creating a natural barrier.
meanings.sent2: The castle rings the village, protecting it from invaders.
meanings.sent3: The fence rings the garden to keep out the rabbits.
meanings.sent4: The mountains rings the valley like a protective embrace.
meanings.sent5: The wall rings the ancient city, preserving its history.
